editPersonalInfo

public static void editPersonalInfo(account.Employee employee)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This method takes an employee object, with attributes that differ from the attributes in the database. It updates the database with this employee information. The attribute that should not change is the employee's accountID (Java class) which is equivalent to the employeeID in the database.

Parameters:
employee - an Employee object with attributes that we want to save
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

editPersonalInfo

public static void editPersonalInfo(account.Customer customer)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This method takes an customer object, with attributes that differ from the attributes in the database. It updates the database with this customer information. The attribute that should not change is the customer's accountID (Java class) which is equivalent to the customerID in the database.

Parameters:
customer - an customer object with attributes that we want to save
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

generateNewID

public int generateNewID(java.lang.String accountType)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                         account.AccountLimitReachedException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
This method generates a new employee or customer ID. It finds the highest previous value of the ID and adds one to it to obtain a new unique ID. If there are no values in the database, then it automatically starts at the minimum possible value.

Parameters:
accountType - the type of account. Must be either employee or customer
Returns:
the new ID
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a connection the database cannot be made
account.AccountLimitReachedException - if the maximum number of accounts, either customer or employee depending on the accountType, has been reached
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the accountType is not customer or employee
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

                     throws java.sql.SQLException,

Promotes an employee to manager

Parameters:
employeeID - The employeeID of the employee being promoted
